api_errors.description: Definition of standard errors returned by MetaCPAN API

code.description: A 3 digits code representing the error.

message.description: The error message designed for human consumption with more details about the error.

param.description: If the error is parameter-specific, the parameter related to the error.

api_errors.title: APIErrors

author_mapping.description: This is the object representing the availble fields for the [author object](https://explorer.metacpan.org/?url=/author/_mapping).

cover.description: This is the object representing a MetaCPAN [module coverage](http://cpancover.com/)

get.description: The `/distribution` endpoint accepts the name of a distribution (e.g. [/distribution/Moose](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/distribution/Moose)), which returns information about the distribution which is not specific to a version (like RT bug counts)

parameters.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be provided.
parameters.name: fields

get.description:
Retrieves a download URL for a given module.
The `/download_url` endpoint exists specifically for the `cpanm` client.  It takes a module name with an optional version (or range of versions) and an optional `dev` flag (for development releases) and returns a `download_url` as well as some other helpful info.

Obviously anyone can use this endpoint, but we'll only consider changes to this endpoint after considering how `cpanm` might be affected.

parameters.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be provided.
parameters.name: fields

get.description: Returns the corresponding `file` of the latest version of the `module`. Considering that Moose-2.0001 is the latest release, the result of [/module/Moose](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/module/Moose) is the same as [/file/DOY/Moose-2.0001/lib/Moose.pm](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/file/DOY/Moose-2.0001/lib/Moose.pm).

get.description:
Returns the POD of the given module. You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown

parameters.description:
You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown
parameters.name: content-type

get.description:
Returns the POD of the given module. You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown

parameters.description:
You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown
parameters.name: content-type

get.description: Takes some POD data and check for errors. It returns the POD provided in formatted plan text.

parameters.description: The POD data to format
parameters.name: pod

schema.example:
Hello World
    Something here

POD ERRORS
    Hey! The above document had some coding errors, which are explained below:

    Around line 7:
        Unknown directive: =oops

post.description: Takes some POD data and check for errors. It returns the POD provided in formatted plan text.

get.description:
Retrieves an distribution release information details.
This `/release` endpoint accepts  the name of an `author` and the name of the `release` (e.g. [/release/DOY/Moose-2.0001](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/release/DOY/Moose-2.0001)), which returns the most recent release of the distribution.

parameters.description: Specifies which object to [join](https://github.com/metacpan/metacpan-api/blob/master/docs/API-docs.md#joins) in the result.
parameters.name: join

parameters.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be provided.
parameters.name: fields

get.description:

get.description: Perform API search in the same fashion as the Web UI

parameters.description:
The query search term. If the search term contains a term with the tags `dist:` or `module:` results will be in expanded form, otherwise collapsed form.

See also `collapsed`
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: The offset to use in the result set
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Force a collapsed even when searching for a particular distribution or module name.
parameters.name: collapsed

parameters.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be provided.
parameters.name: fields

get.description:
Returns the POD of the given module. You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/Moose?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown
Returns the full source of the latest, authorized version of the given `module`.
